relation: configure terminal Example: Device# configure terminal
interface type number Example: Device(config)# interface fastethernet 0/0
ipv6 address ipv6-address / prefix-length | prefix-name ipv6-prefix / prefix-length | autoconfig [default-route]} Example: Device(config-if)# ipv6 address 2001:DB8:0:7262::62/64
glbp group ipv6 [ipv6-address | autoconfig] Example: Device(config-if)# glbp 1 ipv6 FE80::60:3E47:AC8:8
show glbp [interface-type interface-number] [group] [state] [brief] Example: Device(config)# show glbp 10
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Specifies an interface type and number, and enters interface configuration mode.
Configures an IPv6 address based on an IPv6 general prefix and enables IPv6 processing on an interface.
Exits interface configuration mode, and returns the router to global configuration mode.
(Optional) Displays information about GLBP groups on a router. Use the optional brief keyword to display a single line of information about each virtual gateway or virtual forwarder.
pageTitle: First Hop Redundancy Protocols Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS Release 15M&T - FHRP - GLBP Support for IPv6 [Cisco IOS 15.4M&T] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {23660=GLBP supports up to 1024 virtual routers (GLBP groups) on each physical interface of a router and up to four virtual forwarders per group.}
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 7.    show glbp [interface-type interface-number] [group] [state] [brief] 6.    exit 5.    glbp group ipv6 [ipv6-address | autoconfig] 4.    ipv6 address ipv6-address / prefix-length | prefix-name ipv6-prefix / prefix-length | autoconfig [default-route]} 3.    interface type number 2.    configure terminal 1.    enable SUMMARY STEPS If VLANs are in use on an interface, the GLBP group number must be different for each VLAN. Before You Begin
textAfterTable: Troubleshooting GLBP Before You Begin This task requires a router running GLBP to be attached directly to a console. SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    configure terminal 3.    no logging console 4.    Use Telnet to access a router port and repeat Steps 1 and 2. 5.    end 6.    terminal monitor 7.    debug condition glbp interface-type interface-number group [forwarder] 8.    terminal no monitor DETAILED STEPS
